channel.title: Home on Zhenyu's Page
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Zhenyu's Page

item.title: EUSIPCO'18 tutorial
item.description: I will be giving a tutorial at the 26th European Signal Processing Conference (EUSIPCO’18) in Rome, the Eternal City, Italy, together with my Ph.D. supervisor Prof. Romain Couillet and my colleague Xiaoyi Mai on the topic of “Random Matrix Advances in Machine Learning and Neural Nets”. For more information please visit EUSIPCO’18. Abstract The advent of the Big Data era has triggered a renewed interest for machine learning and (deep) neural networks.

item.title: EUSIPCO'18 tutorial
item.description: I will be presenting our work about Random Feature Maps at Colloque GRETSI’17 this September at Juan Les Pins, France. The slides (in French) are available here.

item.title: EUSIPCO'18 tutorial
item.description: I will be presenting my work on LS-SVM at the 42nd IEEE International Conference on Acoustics, Speech and Signal Processing (ICASSP 2017), New Orleans, USA. Here is the link to this four-paper conference paper. A extended journal version which contains all proof in detail is available here. The slides presented on ICASSP 2017 are available here.

item.title: EUSIPCO'18 tutorial
item.description: My colleague Xiaoyi Mai will be presenting our paper on high dimensional logistic regression at ICASSP’19, 12-17 May, Brighton, UK. The slides are available here.

item.title: EUSIPCO'18 tutorial
item.description: I will be presenting our works on Random Feature-based Clustering as well as Gradient Descent Dynamics at ICML 2018 this July, please find the two papers as follows: [On the Spectrum of Random Features Maps of High Dimensional Data] and the slides here [The Dynamics of Learning: A Random Matrix Approach] and the slides here.

item.title: Ph.D. Mid-term
item.description: I’ve just finished my Ph.D. mid-term evaluation at CentraleSupelec. Here is the link of my mid-term report as well the slides.

Self Introduction - By Zhenyu LiaoSelf IntroductionZhenyu Liao (廖振宇), CentraleSupelec, Paris-Sacaly, France.ResearchMy research interests are broadly in machine learning, random matrix theory and statistics.Tutorial and invited talks■ Tutorial at the 26th European Signal Processing Conference (EUSIPCO’18), Roma, Italy, 2018.■ Invited talks at SJTU, HUAWEI, iCODE, Matrix, SUFE.Paper reviewNeurIPS, ICML, IEEE TSP, NPL. Education■ B.Sc. Optical & Electronic Information, HUST, 2010-2014■ M.Sc. Signal and Image Processing, CentraleSupelec/Paris-Sud, 2014-2016■ Ph.D. Statistics and Computer Science, CentraleSupelec, 2016-2019Visit my personal website for more information.

item.title: Activities
item.description: Talks Invited talk on “Recent Advances in Random Matrix Theory for Machine Learning and Neural Nets”, workshop of the Matrix series on “Random matrix theory faces information era”, Kraków, Poland, May, 2019. Invited talk on “Dynamical aspects of Deep Learning” (with Y. Chitour), Séminaire d’Automatique du plateau de Saclay of iCODE, Paris, France, 2019. See paper here. Invited talk on “Recent Advances in Random Matrix for Neural Networks”, workshop on deep learning theory, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, China, 2018.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Conferences: Z.Liao, R. Couillet, “Inner-product Kernels are Asymptotically Equivalent to Binary Discrete Kernels”, (submitted to) The 33rd Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS’19), Vancouver, Canada, 2019. X. Mai, Z. Liao, R. Couillet, “A Large Scale Analysis of Logistic Regression: Asymptotic Performance and New Insights”, 2019 IEEE International Conference on Acoustics, Speech and Signal Processing (ICASSP’19), Brighton, UK, 2019. [poster] R. Couillet, Z. Liao, X. Mai, “Classification Asymptotics in the Random Matrix Regime”, The 26th European Signal Processing Conference (EUSIPCO’18), Rome, Italy, 2018.
